name: Broiled Salmon with Spring Peas
description: Grab the recipe for this super easy and fuss free broiled salmon with spring peas! It's dinner in 15 minutes or less and perfect for a quick weeknight meal.
ingredients: ▢ 1 10-ounce package frozen peas, completely thawed and blanched
▢ ½ cup sugar snap peas, thinly sliced
▢ ⅓ cup finely grated Pecorino Romano cheese, plus more to finish
▢ kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper
▢ kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper
instructions: Preheat broiler. Place salmon on a foil lined baking sheet, season with salt and pepper and broil 8-10 minutes or until golden.While the salmon is broiling, transfer the garlic to a medium bowl and add the pecorino, a few tablespoons of olive oil, lemon juice, red pepper flakes, salt, and plenty of black pepper, and whisk to combine. Add the blanched peas. Taste and adjust salt and pepper as needed.Use the back of a fork and just roughly mash half of the peas so they are a little more chunky and leave the other half whole. Add the sliced sugar snap peas and dill, taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Spoon on top of the cooked salmon and serve immediately.
